result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Derome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*1/19/17 AMENDED Restitution amount.
7Due during first year of supervision.
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Cts 1-2: Court costs due during period of supervision
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants
Defendant to submit to random testing
Cooperate with all programming/treatment as directed by agent, including but not limited to AODA and CGIP (Thinking for change) program
No contact with Ye Olde Pharmacy
No contact with drug users or sellers whatsoever
Not to possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Take prescribed medications only as prescribed and inform agent of any prescriptions that are prescribed.
Use only one pharmacy
Sign releases for agent to speak with physician and pharmacy
Submit to DNA sample on jail report date

Defendant Michael D Derome in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties in receipt of PSI with corrections placed on the record. Sentencing letters filed with the court. Recommendation by the State. Statement by defense counsel. Court renders sentence.
DA to receive electronically.  Faxed to Atty Baltz.  Copy forwarded to B3.
Sentencing hearing on October 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael D Derome in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. State requests PSI. State recommends upon plea to count 1 & 2: Withheld sentence with duration up to court's discretion, 6 months condition time. Court orders PSI be completed. Court advises defendant he is still under bail conditions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
